articles.snippet: Tiger Woods’s life came apart 10 years ago. Then came surgeries on his back, battles with painkillers. Another green jacket would be nice.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — The 10th anniversary of the Thanksgiving night car crash that changed the course of golf history is months away. But as a smiling Tiger Woods exited the Augusta National Golf Club clubhouse on Tuesday to cheers and applause, it was not too soon to consider his renaissance since the fall from grace that began when his then wife chased her philandering husband from their home and he drove his S.U.V. into a neighbor’s tree.
articles.abstract: Tiger Woods’s life came apart 10 years ago. Then came surgeries on his back, battles with painkillers. Another green jacket would be nice.

headline.main: Tiger Woods Hunts for Another Masters, a Decade After Crash
headline.print_headline: The Crash, the Fall and the Road Back

articles.snippet: Tiger Woods led for part of the opening round. He shot a two-under-par 70, the same first-round score he had when he won in 1997, 2001 and 2002.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — The methodical, ever calculating Bryson DeChambeau, who last week put himself through a 14-hour practice session to decipher the effect of what he called the “spin loft curve” of his wedges, was asked late Thursday to assess the final nine holes of his first round at the 2019 Masters.
articles.abstract: Tiger Woods led for part of the opening round. He shot a two-under-par 70, the same first-round score he had when he won in 1997, 2001 and 2002.

headline.main: Brooks Koepka and Bryson DeChambeau Share the Masters Lead
headline.print_headline: DeChambeau and Koepka Surge Into Lead

articles.snippet: Five major winners, including Francesco Molinari and Brooks Koepka, are tied at seven under par after the second round. Woods, despite a mishap on the course, is a stroke behind.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — As Tiger Woods was making his stirring late charge up a bunched Masters leaderboard Friday, he was chasing a formidable cast of rivals that included six major golf championship winners.
articles.abstract: Five major winners, including Francesco Molinari and Brooks Koepka, are tied at seven under par after the second round. Woods, despite a mishap on the course, is a stroke behind.

headline.main: A Pack of Champs Lead the Masters, and Tiger Woods Refuses to Be Tripped Up
headline.print_headline: A Crowd of Champions Leads the Pack

articles.snippet: As he stood on the 12th green, glaring at Francesco Molinari and Tony Finau, Woods found the killer instinct he — and golf as a whole — had been missing.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — If Tiger Woods’s victory at the 2019 Masters is among the greatest comebacks in sports history — and it is at least a leading candidate — its origin will forever be traced to what happened on the 12th hole on Sunday when the old Tiger Woods suddenly reappeared at a major championship for the first time in 11 years.
articles.abstract: As he stood on the 12th green, glaring at Francesco Molinari and Tony Finau, Woods found the killer instinct he — and golf as a whole — had been missing.

headline.main: Tiger Woods Showed He Was Back Not With a Shot, but With a Stare

articles.snippet: After four back operations and nearly a decade of struggles on and off the golf course, Woods is back at the pinnacle.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — Tiger Woods completed a comeback from personal and professional adversity on Sunday, capturing his fifth Masters title and his 15th major tournament with a victory that snapped a decade-long championship drought and instantly returned him to the top of the sports world.
articles.abstract: After four back operations and nearly a decade of struggles on and off the golf course, Woods is back at the pinnacle.

headline.main: Tiger Woods, in a Stirring Return to the Top, Captures the Masters at 43
headline.print_headline: Triumph Ends Woods’s Years In Wilderness

articles.snippet: A favorable schedule could put Woods in position for a serious run at winning all four majors this year, a feat never accomplished in the modern era.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — Jack Nicklaus was fishing in the Bahamas on Sunday as Tiger Woods resumed circling him in the quest for Nicklaus’s record of 18 major golf championships. But in his news conference after winning the Masters for his 15th major title, Woods didn’t sound exactly bloodthirsty.
articles.abstract: A favorable schedule could put Woods in position for a serious run at winning all four majors this year, a feat never accomplished in the modern era.

headline.main: Tiger Woods Shook Up Golf at the Masters. It Might Be Just the Beginning.

articles.snippet: The president has lavished praise on Woods, a golf and business partner, for winning the Masters on Sunday in a dramatic comeback.
articles.lead_paragraph: A day after Tiger Woods won his fifth Masters title and 15th major tournament in a rousing resurrection of his career, President Trump said Monday he would give him an honor almost as exclusive as a green jacket from Augusta National Golf Club: the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
articles.abstract: The president has lavished praise on Woods, a golf and business partner, for winning the Masters on Sunday in a dramatic comeback.

headline.main: Trump Says He Will Give Tiger Woods the Presidential Medal of Freedom
headline.print_headline: Trump Promises Woods a Top Honor

articles.snippet: After his Masters triumph, fans began looking ahead. Is he back, after a decade of injury and personal adversity? Or was the comeback a last hurrah?
articles.lead_paragraph: The cheers were still reverberating around Augusta National after Tiger Woods’s  triumph in the Masters on Sunday, but fans were already starting to look ahead. Is Woods back after a decade of injury and personal adversity? Could he, at age 43, regain the form that had him destroying fields from 1997 to 2008? Or was the comeback a kind of fool’s gold, a last hurrah before the decline sets in again?
articles.abstract: After his Masters triumph, fans began looking ahead. Is he back, after a decade of injury and personal adversity? Or was the comeback a last hurrah?

articles.snippet: Golf is all about how you react when you get a bad bounce.
articles.lead_paragraph: Although my day job is writing the foreign affairs column for The New York Times — more Persian Gulf than fairway golf — thinking about golf and playing as often as I can is my all-consuming hobby. So like millions of others, I was awed by Tiger Woods’s comeback for the ages by his winning the Masters at 43 years old. What can be learned from it?
articles.abstract: Golf is all about how you react when you get a bad bounce.

headline.main: Tiger Woods and the Game of Life
headline.print_headline: Tiger Woods and the Game of Life

articles.snippet: What are the greatest comebacks in history?
articles.lead_paragraph: What is your reaction to Tiger Woods winning the Masters tournament on April 14, snapping a decade-long championship drought?
articles.abstract: What are the greatest comebacks in history?

articles.snippet: Economists at the bank think the president has a “narrow” advantage over Democratic challengers in his re-election bid.
articles.lead_paragraph: Good Monday morning. ICYMI: Tiger Woods wasn’t the only winner from the Masters yesterday. So was Nike — which turned out this ad within minutes of his victory. (Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up here.)
articles.abstract: Economists at the bank think the president has a “narrow” advantage over Democratic challengers in his re-election bid.

headline.main: DealBook Briefing: Goldman Says Trump Could Squeak a Win in 2020

articles.snippet: His story is a reminder of whose transgressions can be set apart from their redemption stories.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last Sunday, when Tiger Woods won the Masters after his long drought, it was more than just one of the most incredible comebacks in history. It showed America’s eagerness to embrace a man who persevered through years of setbacks, especially self-inflicted ones, regardless of whatever selective amnesia that requires.
articles.abstract: His story is a reminder of whose transgressions can be set apart from their redemption stories.

headline.main: Why Don’t Women Get Comebacks Like Tiger Woods?
headline.print_headline: Women Don’t Get  Comebacks Like Tiger

articles.snippet: After winning the Masters last month, his first major in a decade, Woods will become the fourth golfer to be given the nation’s highest civilian honor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods will be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President Trump on Monday, the White House said Thursday.
articles.abstract: After winning the Masters last month, his first major in a decade, Woods will become the fourth golfer to be given the nation’s highest civilian honor.

headline.main: Tiger Woods to Receive Presidential Medal of Freedom on Monday
headline.print_headline: Woods to Receive Honor From Trump on Monday

articles.snippet: President Trump offered the honor to Mr. Woods soon after the golfer won the Masters last month for his 15th major championship — and his first in almost 11 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Monday awarded Tiger Woods the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, in a Rose Garden ceremony in which both men described the golfer’s athletic triumphs set against painful personal lows.
articles.abstract: President Trump offered the honor to Mr. Woods soon after the golfer won the Masters last month for his 15th major championship — and his first in almost 11 years.

headline.main: ‘I’ve Battled,’ Tiger Woods Says as He Accepts Presidential Medal of Freedom
headline.print_headline: Accepting  Top Medal,  Woods Says  He ‘Battled’

articles.snippet: The crowd was there for Tiger Woods, but Koepka shot a 63 in the first round of the 2019 P.G.A. Championship. He believes he could have done even better.
articles.lead_paragraph: FARMINGDALE, N.Y. — Brooks Koepka has won three of the last eight major golf championships, including last year’s P.G.A. Championship. He ranks third in the world, he tied for second at this year’s Masters, and he has not shot a round over par since mid-March.
articles.abstract: The crowd was there for Tiger Woods, but Koepka shot a 63 in the first round of the 2019 P.G.A. Championship. He believes he could have done even better.

headline.main: Brooks Koepka, Happily in the Shadows, Sets Bethpage Black Record
headline.print_headline: Out of Spotlight, Koepka Sets Bethpage Black Record

articles.snippet: Woods had hoped to build on an exhilarating Masters win in April. Instead, he had two rounds of bogey-filled golf.
articles.lead_paragraph: FARMINGDALE, N.Y. — The Tiger Woods of old entered every tournament expecting to win. An older, wiser Woods returned last year from his fourth back operation with tempered expectations.
articles.abstract: Woods had hoped to build on an exhilarating Masters win in April. Instead, he had two rounds of bogey-filled golf.

headline.main: Tiger Woods Misses the Cut at the P.G.A. Championship by 1 Stroke
headline.print_headline: Woods Finds the Limits of a Revived Career

articles.snippet: His journey back has been morally and medically arduous. But here he is, basking in adulation, smiling with President Trump, defying his sport’s and society’s expectations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last month, the president awarded Tiger Woods the Presidential Medal of Freedom. The ceremony took place in the White House Rose Garden, a couple of weeks after Woods’s desperately prayed-for win at the Masters golf tournament.
articles.abstract: His journey back has been morally and medically arduous. But here he is, basking in adulation, smiling with President Trump, defying his sport’s and society’s expectations.

headline.main: A Tolerable Redemption for Tiger Woods
headline.print_headline: An Idol Who Fell Embraces A 2nd Act

articles.snippet: Since his dramatic Masters victory in April, Woods has struggled to compete, adjusting his workload according to his back pain.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERSEY CITY — From Liberty National Golf Club’s 10th tee box, Tiger Woods hit toward a distant Manhattan skyline shrouded in clouds. The imagery was crystalline even if the horizon was not.
articles.abstract: Since his dramatic Masters victory in April, Woods has struggled to compete, adjusting his workload according to his back pain.

headline.main: In His Twilight, Tiger Woods Searches for the Bright Spots
headline.print_headline: In His Twilight, Woods Seeks Bright Spots

articles.snippet: Neither Tiger Woods, the Masters winner, nor Shane Lowry, the British Open champ, made the 30-man field of the playoff finale, the Tour Championship. Some players in the field are questioning the rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — With the PGA Tour’s top players making piles of money, its commissioner was grappling with how to keep his stars interested and invested in competitive golf after the conclusion of the majors season.
articles.abstract: Neither Tiger Woods, the Masters winner, nor Shane Lowry, the British Open champ, made the 30-man field of the playoff finale, the Tour Championship. Some players in the field are questioning the rules.

headline.main: Are the FedEx Cup Playoffs Rewarding the Wrong Players?
headline.print_headline: The Tour Confronts an Existential Question: Majors or Money?
